ticket.title: 3.0 validates vs. validate
ticket.original-body:
If the user declares
class Foo < ActiveRecord::Base validate :foo, { :acceptance => true } end
with the singular "validate" rather than "validates", we get something that looks a lot like a validator declaration but silently does nothing.
